handNote.p: Tamil script. No two-curled kompu, nor puḷḷi.

binding.p: Woodcovers apparently fabricated in the BnF.

origin.origDate: No internal date. Late 18th or early 19th century.

acquisition.p: Tolfrey. See ink label on the top right corner of f15v: “Tolfrey. 4.” The manuscript is described by Fauriel (1891, f6r). This Tolfrey seems to be Samuel Tolfrey, as one of the manuscript of the BnF Tolfrey collection bears the label “Saml. Tolfrey Esqre” (see Linayaratne 1983, N° 30, p. 104).

body.p: The manuscript contains five Tamil syllabaries in succession, by seemingly different hands. All these syllabaries are designated as arivari in the left margin on the recto of their first folio. The Madras Tamil Lexicon tells us s.v. “அரிவரி ari-vari, n.”: “Alphabet book, the first line of which begins with அரி, Viṣṇu.” This is not the case here as we have classical Tamil syllabaries in lay-out and conceptualisation (e.g. order of letters). There are at least three different hands but, from the examination of physical object (palm-leaf type and dimensions), there is no question that we have only one codicological unit. For the sake of clarity, the text is not inscribed in scriptio continua, but the letters are clearly demarcated by space, dots, and lay-out.

The order of presentation of the letters is the same in the five alphabets: 1 line for the initial vowels series, complemented by the āytam; 1 line for the series of 18 consonants, each with the vocalisation a; 18 lines, 1 per individual consonant, with the full range of vocalisations and again the consonant with the vocalisation a.
The bundle contains between the two woodcovers:

U1: 5 folios, unfoliated = syllabary n° 1. 10 pages, 2 lines per page, by hand n° 1. All the letters (265) are numbered in smaller script (in Tamil and in Latin numerals). The handwriting is very carefully executed.
U2: 2 folios, unfoliated = syllabary n° 2. 3 pages, 8 then 4 lines per page, by hand n° 2.
U3: 2 folios, unfoliated = syllabary n° 3. 4 pages, 6 then 2 lines per page, by hand n° 3.
U4: 3 folios, unfoliated = syllabary n° 4. 5 pages, 4 lines per page, by hand n° 4.
U5: 3 folios, unfoliated = syllabary n° 5, 5 pages. 4 lines per page, by hand n° 5 (?).

U1, folio 1, recto and verso, unfoliated = marginal title; incipit, syllabary n° 1.
(f[1]r, lm) Arivari
(f[1]r1) A Ā I Ī U Ū E Ē AI O Ō Ū ḵ
(f[1]r2) ka ṅa ca ña ṭa ṇa ta na pa ma ya ra la va ḻa ḷa ṟa ṉa
(f[1]v1) ka kā kī kī ku ḵū ke ke kai ko ko kau ka
(f[1]v2) ṅa ṅā ṅi ṅī ṅu ṅū ṅe ṅē ṅai ṅo ṅō ṅau ṅa

U1, folio 5, verso, unfoliated = excipit, syllabary n° 1.
(f[5]v1) ṟa ṟā ṟi ṟī ṟu ṟū ṟe ṟē ṟai ṟo ṟō ṟau ṟa
(f[5]v2) ṉa ṉā ṉi ṉī ṉu ṉū ṉe ṉē ṉai ṉo ṉō ṉau ṉa
Abbreviations. c = column, f = folio, lm = left margin, r = recto, rm = right margin, U = unit (codicological and/or textual), v = verso.
Unmarked puḷḷi, ō, and ē restored. Uppercase for initial vowels (in excerpts only). .
